name: Free Travel in S.T Bus to the Disabled Persons

Under this scheme, the benefit of free travel in all types of busses of the Gujarat State Road Transport Corporation is provided to Persons with Disabilities in all state routes and also provides the benefit of travel to the last route out of state. The scheme is fully funded by the state government.

faqs.question: Is the scheme funded by the state government?

name: Travel Grants To Goan Authors
description: The scheme "Travel Grants To Goan Authors" is a state-level cultural scheme by the Kala Academy, Department of Art and Culture, Government of Goa. The objective of the scheme is to enable the Goan writers to come in close contact with the senior writers of a language-region other than their own within India to acquaint them with the writers and the people of that region, and to widen their awareness and sensibility about the country as a nation.
benefits: The grant amount will be decided by Kala Academy with provision for an advance upto 75% of the total grant for a maximum of two Goan authors.

faqs.answer: The scheme enables Goan writers to connect with senior writers from other language regions within India, helping them broaden their awareness and understanding of the country’s literary and cultural diversity.

faqs.question: How many authors are selected for the travel grant each year under this program?
faqs.answer: A maximum of two Goan authors are selected annually for the travel grant.

faqs.question: Where can I find the complete rules and regulations regarding eligibility for this travel grant?
faqs.answer: The rules and regulations are available free of cost at Kala Academy.

faqs.question: What are the financial requirements after receiving the travel grant, and what documents must I submit post-travel?

faqs.question: Who is the designated authority responsible for receiving and processing the travel grant applications?

faqs.question: If I face any issues or have grievances regarding the application process, whom should I contact?
faqs.answer: Grievances can be addressed to either the Member Secretary or the Chairman of Kala Academy, Goa.

faqs.question: How are applicants informed about the opening of applications for this travel grant scheme?
faqs.answer: Press announcements are released in local print and electronic media to invite entries from interested authors.

faqs.question: Is there a specific deadline for submitting the application, and where can I find this information?
faqs.answer: The stipulated deadline for submission will be mentioned in the press announcements released by Kala Academy.

faqs.question: Do I need to provide a detailed travel plan as part of my application, and what should it include?

faqs.question: Can I apply if I am a writer from outside Goa but currently residing in the state?
faqs.answer: The scheme is specifically for Goan authors; residency or origin eligibility details should be confirmed with Kala Academy.

faqs.answer: The scheme encourages interaction with writers from a language-region other than the applicant’s own within India.

name: Baristha Nagarika Tirtha Yatra Yojana
description: The scheme “Baristha Nagarika Tirtha Yatra Yojana (BNTYY)” was launched by the Department of Tourism, Government of Odisha on 01st February 2016 in collaboration with IRCTC (Indian Railway Catering and Tourism Corporation) wherein the pilgrims will be taken on a visit to different pilgrimage centers in the country from particular boarding points in the state as per the schedule approved for the journeys. The scheme is envisaged to help senior citizens over 60-75 years of age to undertake pilgrimage with Government assistance.

with the support of the state.This scheme will be offered to people of all regions/faiths.The scheme is envisaged to help senior citizens over 60-75 years of age to undertake pilgrimage with Government assistance.Facilities for pilgrims:The district administration will make arrangements for transportation of the selected pilgrims including their attendants to district HQ and further to the “Starting Point” i.e. originating railway station or directly from home to the starting point and also on the return journey from the “Starting Point “ back to their homes.Arrangements for stay and food for the pilgrims coming from various districts on the day previous to the actual departure will be done by the district administration of the “Starting Point” i.e. originating station.Vegetarian Meals
Tea & Snacks with Drinking Water throughout the journey

and medical facilities with professional physicians shall be provided by IRCTC.The tentative food menu to be provided at the starting point by the Tourism Department as well as during the journey by IRCTC are as follows:  Break Fast-8-9 AM- Upama & Dalma/ Puri & Veg. Mix. Curry/Idlee
Veg. Curry & Water.The travel kit shall be provided by IRCTC to the pilgrims within a cost as per the MOU signed between the state Govt. & IRCTC for each year. The kit shall contain a toothbrush
identity card & a bag. The bag shall be properly branded with the Odisha Tourism logo.If pilgrims desire to avail of any facility other than that prescribed by the Government during the journey
then they will have to make payment for the same. Tourism Dept. / IRCTC cannot take responsibility for the extra services desired by the pilgrims.

an attendant can also accompany applicants above 70 years of age. The application of the attendant should be a joint application with the prospective 'Pilgrim'.The attendant has to pay 50% of the travel cost in the shape of a Bank Draft drawn on scheduled banks in favour of the Director

Tourism payable at Bhubaneswar along with the application.The attendant should be over 18 years of age.A married couple can apply 'jointly' for the pilgrimage trip. Their joint application will be treated as one application
but
the facilities provided will be individual. The joint application will be held eligible even if one of the spouses is less than 60 years of age.Under the scheme

if any

during the entire duration of the pilgrimage up till the time they reach their homes.The selected pilgrims should not deviate from the scheduled program journey and site visits under any circumstances.The pilgrims should listen to the instructions of the IRCTC officials during the entire duration of the journey.The pilgrims should maintain good behaviour among themselves and with IRCTC officials

ii. Ration Card under NFSA   iii. Widow Pension/ Old Age Pension   iv. MGNREGS Job Card   v. The auto inclusion and the deprivation criteria used by the Panchayati Raj Department which has replaced the criteria for identification of BPL category people and weaker sections for different development schemes can be used to filter the eligible applicants for this scheme.vi. Any other similar documents issued by the State Govt. reflecting their weak economic status or deprivation.

faqs.question: What is “Baristha Nagarika Tirtha Yatra Yojana (BNTYY)”?
faqs.answer: BNTYY is a pilgrimage scheme launched by the Department of Tourism, Government of Odisha, in collaboration with IRCTC (Indian Railway Catering and Tourism Corporation).

faqs.question: When was this scheme launched?
faqs.answer: The scheme was officially launched on 01st February 2016.

faqs.question: What is the primary objective of the Senior Citizens Pilgrimage Scheme?
faqs.answer: The State Tourism Department's Senior Citizens Pilgrimage Scheme aims to offer a significant opportunity to the poor and deprived senior citizens of the state.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to participate in the State Tourism Department Senior Citizens Pilgrimage Scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme is designed for senior citizens aged 60 to 75 years who belong to all regions and faiths within the state.

faqs.question: How does this scheme benefit senior citizens?
faqs.answer: The scheme offers government assistance to senior citizens, facilitating their pilgrimage journeys, and providing an opportunity to fulfill their spiritual aspirations.

faqs.question: Is this scheme only for the domicile of Odisha?
faqs.answer: Yes, the applicant has to be a domicile of Odisha.

faqs.question: Can individuals from any faith or region apply for the Senior Citizens Pilgrimage Scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, the scheme is inclusive and open to senior citizens of all faiths and regions within the state.

faqs.question: Can participants choose their pilgrimage destinations, or is there a predetermined schedule?
faqs.answer: The pilgrimage destinations and schedule are pre-approved and organized by the Department of Tourism. Participants will be taken to different pilgrimage centers as per the approved schedule.

faqs.question: What are the fitness requirements for applicants under the pilgrimage scheme?
faqs.answer: Applicants are required to have the requisite fitness to undertake the journey. They should not be suffering from any communicable disease that may pose a risk during the pilgrimage. This criterion ensures the well-being and safety of the participants.

faqs.question: Can an attendant accompany applicants, and under what conditions?
faqs.answer: Yes, under the scheme, an attendant can accompany applicants who are above 70 years of age. The inclusion of an attendant aims to provide additional support and assistance to elderly pilgrims during their journey.

faqs.question: How does the application process work for an attendant?
faqs.answer: The application for an attendant should be a joint application with the prospective pilgrim. Both the pilgrim and the attendant need to submit their applications together. Additionally, the attendant is required to pay 50% of the travel cost through a Bank Draft drawn on scheduled banks in favor of the Director, Tourism, payable at Bhubaneswar along with the joint application.

faqs.question: Is there an age requirement for attendants?
faqs.answer: Yes, the attendant accompanying the applicant should be over 18 years of age.

faqs.question: Can a pilgrim avail the benefits of the journey under the scheme more than once?
faqs.answer: No, the scheme stipulates that a pilgrim can avail the benefit of the journey only once in a lifetime.

faqs.question: How can an applicant apply online under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The applicants visit and apply through the official website of the Department of Tourism, Odisha: https://yatra.odisha.gov.in/.

name: Punjab Farm Tourism Scheme

The concept will also help to provide additional sources of income to the farming community. Thus, it will be a complete package of farm tourism, adventure tourism, rural and village tourism and cultural tourism to visiting tourists in the predominantly agricultural State of Punjab. faqs.question: Who can apply for the MDA Scheme?

faqs.question: What is the financial support available for TSPs?

faqs.question: How many tours can a TSP undertake in a year under the scheme?

faqs.question: How to claim reimbursement?

faqs.question: Are there any specific travel conditions for availing air fare reimbursement?

faqs.question: Can financial support be claimed for the same activity from multiple sources?

faqs.question: Can support be claimed for domestic travel?

faqs.question: Is prior approval a guarantee of financial support?

faqs.question: How is the priority determined if there are more applications than available funds?
faqs.answer: Priority is given to service providers who have not availed of financial assistance in the past under the MDA Scheme.
